doc_title: Getting Started with Taxfy - Complete Guide
doc_content:
# Getting Started with Taxfy - Complete Guide

Welcome to Taxfy, South Africa's #1 tax calculator! This comprehensive guide will help you maximize your SARS refund in under 30 seconds.

## What is Taxfy?

Taxfy is a professional-grade tax calculation platform designed specifically for South African tax requirements. We help you:

- **Calculate your exact SARS refund** using your IRP5 or manual entry
- **Generate professional tax reports** in PDF, CSV, and Excel formats
- **Export SARS eFiling-ready data** for seamless submission
- **Validate your tax calculations** with AI-powered accuracy checking

## Quick Start (30 Seconds)

### Step 1: Upload Your IRP5
1. Visit the [Taxfy calculator](https://taxfy.com/upload)
2. Click **"Upload Your IRP5"** or drag & drop your PDF
3. Wait for AI extraction (15-20 seconds)

### Step 2: Review & Calculate
1. Verify extracted data is correct
2. Add any missing deductions (medical aid, retirement)
3. Click **"Calculate My Tax"**

### Step 3: Get Your Results
1. View your instant tax calculation
2. Download professional PDF report
3. Export SARS eFiling data if needed

## Supported Documents

### Primary Documents
- **IRP5 PDF** - Official SARS document (recommended)
- **IRP5A PDF** - For directors and freelancers
- **Manual Entry** - Type in your details directly

### What We Extract
- Gross remuneration
- PAYE tax paid
- UIF contributions
- Retirement fund contributions
- Medical aid contributions
- Travel allowances
- All other allowances and deductions

## Key Features Overview

### ðŸ”¬ AI-Powered Extraction
- **OCR Technology**: Reads any IRP5 PDF format
- **Data Validation**: Cross-checks extracted values
- **Confidence Scoring**: Shows extraction accuracy
- **Manual Override**: Edit any incorrect values

### âš¡ Instant Calculations
- **SARS-Compliant**: Uses 2025/26 tax year rates
- **Real-Time**: Results in under 30 seconds
- **Comprehensive**: Shows full tax breakdown
- **Accurate**: Verified against SARS formulas

### ðŸ“Š Professional Reports
- **Tax Calculation Summary**: Complete breakdown
- **SARS eFiling Export**: Ready-to-submit format
- **Multi-Format**: PDF, CSV, Excel downloads
- **Audit Trail**: Step-by-step calculations

### ðŸ”’ Bank-Grade Security
- **No Data Storage**: Files deleted after processing
- **SSL Encryption**: All data transmitted securely
- **Privacy First**: We never store personal information
- **POPI Compliant**: Meets South African privacy laws

## Understanding Your Results

### Tax Calculation Breakdown
Your results show:

1. **Taxable Income**: Gross income minus deductions
2. **Income Tax**: Based on SARS tax brackets
3. **Tax Rebates**: Primary, secondary, tertiary rebates
4. **Medical Credits**: Tax credits for medical aid
5. **Total Tax**: Final tax liability
6. **Refund/Owing**: Amount due to/from SARS

### Key Metrics Explained

#### Effective Tax Rate
Your actual tax rate after rebates and credits:

Effective Rate = Total Tax Ã· Gross Income Ã— 100
```

#### Marginal Tax Rate
The tax rate on your last rand earned (your tax bracket).

#### Taxable Income Calculation
```
Taxable Income = Gross Income - Retirement Contributions - UIF
```

*Note: Medical aid contributions provide credits, not deductions*

## Tax Year Information

### Current Tax Year: 2025/26
- **Period**: 1 March 2025 - 28 February 2026
- **Filing Deadline**: 31 October 2026 (individuals)
- **Provisional Tax**: 31 August 2025 & 28 February 2026

### Tax Brackets 2025/26
| Income Range | Tax Rate |
|-------------|----------|
| R0 - R237,100 | 18% |
| R237,101 - R370,500 | 26% |
| R370,501 - R512,800 | 31% |
| R512,801 - R673,000 | 36% |
| R673,001 - R857,900 | 39% |
| R857,901 - R1,817,000 | 41% |
| R1,817,001+ | 45% |

### Tax Rebates 2025/26
- **Primary Rebate**: R17,235 (all taxpayers)
- **Secondary Rebate**: R9,444 (65+ years)
- **Tertiary Rebate**: R3,145 (75+ years)

Ready to maximize your refund? [Start your calculation now â†’](https://taxfy.com/upload)
doc_excerpt: Learn how to use Taxfy's AI-powered tax calculator to maximize your SARS refund in under 30 seconds. Complete step-by-step guide for South African taxpayers.

doc_content:
# Freelancer Tax Guide - South Africa 2025/26

Master your freelancer tax obligations with Taxfy's comprehensive guide for independent contractors, consultants, and self-employed professionals in South Africa.

## Who This Guide Is For

- **Independent Contractors** working for multiple clients
- **Freelancers** in creative, tech, and professional services
- **Consultants** providing specialist expertise
- **Gig Workers** earning from multiple platforms
- **Part-Time Freelancers** with employment + freelance income

## Understanding Freelancer Tax Obligations

### Tax Registration Requirements

#### When You Must Register
- **Annual Income > R1,000,000**: Mandatory VAT registration
- **Voluntary VAT**: Register if income > R50,000 annually
- **Income Tax**: All freelancers must register for income tax
- **Provisional Tax**: Required if owing > R1,000 in previous year

#### Required Tax Numbers
- **Tax Reference Number**: Personal income tax
- **VAT Number**: If registered for VAT
- **PAYE Number**: If employing staff
- **UIF Number**: For employee contributions

### Types of Tax Documents for Freelancers

#### IRP5 vs Other Documents
- **IRP5**: If you have employment income
- **IRP5A**: For directors and high-earning freelancers
- **IT3(a)**: For investment income
- **Invoices & Receipts**: For freelance income tracking

## Freelancer Income Types

### 1. Employment + Freelance Income

**Scenario**: You have a day job AND freelance work

#### Tax Treatment
- **Employment Income**: Taxed via PAYE (IRP5)
- **Freelance Income**: Declared as additional income
- **Combined Assessment**: Total income determines tax bracket

#### Using Taxfy for Mixed Income
1. Upload your IRP5 for employment income
2. Use manual entry to add freelance income
3. Include all business deductions
4. Get combined tax calculation

### 2. Pure Freelance Income

**Scenario**: All income from freelance work

#### Tax Treatment
- **Provisional Tax**: Pay twice yearly estimates
- **Annual Return**: Final reconciliation
- **Business Deductions**: Claim all qualifying expenses

#### Calculation Method
```
Total Freelance Income
- Business Expenses (deductible)
- Retirement Contributions (up to 27.5%)
= Taxable Income
```

## Essential Business Deductions for Freelancers

### Home Office Expenses

#### Qualifying Expenses
- **Rent/Bond Portion**: Based on office space percentage
- **Utilities**: Electricity, water, internet (proportional)
- **Insurance**: Home insurance portion for office
- **Maintenance**: Repairs and upkeep (proportional)

#### Calculation Method
```
Office Size Ã· Total Home Size Ã— Total Expense = Deductible Amount
```

**Example**: 20mÂ² office in 100mÂ² home = 20% of qualifying expenses

### Equipment & Technology

#### Fully Deductible
- **Computers & laptops** (business use only)
- **Software subscriptions** (Adobe, Microsoft, etc.)
- **Professional tools** specific to your trade
- **Smartphones** (if primarily for business)

### Travel & Transportation

#### Vehicle Expenses
- **Business Kilometers**: R3.98 per km (2025/26 rate)
- **Actual Costs**: Fuel, maintenance, insurance (business %)
- **Parking & Tolls**: For business travel
- **Vehicle Finance**: Interest portion (business use)

## Provisional Tax for Freelancers

### Who Pays Provisional Tax
- Freelancers owing > R1,000 in the previous year
- Income not subject to PAYE deductions
- Business owners and consultants

### Payment Dates 2025/26
- **First Payment**: 31 August 2025
- **Second Payment**: 28 February 2026
- **Late Payment Penalty**: 20% interest per annum

## Using Taxfy for Freelancer Taxes

### Step-by-Step Process

#### 1. Gather Your Documents
- IRP5 (if you have employment income)
- All freelance income records
- Business expense receipts
- Previous year's tax assessment

#### 2. Calculate Your Income
- Upload IRP5 using Taxfy's AI extraction
- Manually add freelance income amounts
- Include all income sources
- Convert foreign income to ZAR

Ready to optimize your freelancer tax position? [Calculate your taxes now â†’](https://taxfy.com/upload)
doc_excerpt: Complete tax guide for South African freelancers, contractors and self-employed professionals. Learn about deductions, provisional tax, VAT registration and compliance requirements.

doc_content:
# Business Tax Guide - South Africa 2025/26

Complete tax compliance guide for South African businesses, from SMEs to large corporations. Master corporate tax, VAT, PAYE, and advanced compliance with Taxfy's enterprise-grade platform.

## Business Entity Types & Tax Implications

### 1. Private Companies (Pty Ltd)

#### Tax Obligations
- **Corporate Income Tax**: 27% on taxable income
- **Dividends Tax**: 20% on distributions to shareholders
- **VAT Registration**: Mandatory if turnover > R1 million
- **PAYE**: For employee remuneration
- **UIF**: Employee and employer contributions

#### Key Benefits
- **Limited Liability**: Personal asset protection
- **Tax Planning**: Flexible distribution strategies
- **Credibility**: Enhanced business reputation
- **Perpetual Existence**: Continuous operation

### 2. Close Corporations (CC)

#### Tax Treatment
- **Member's Drawings**: Taxed as deemed remuneration
- **Profits**: Distributed as deemed dividends
- **Corporate Tax**: 27% on retained profits
- **Personal Tax**: On member's share of profits

### 3. Sole Proprietorships

#### Tax Structure
- **Personal Income Tax**: Individual rates apply
- **Business Income**: Included in personal assessment
- **VAT**: Registration if turnover > R1 million
- **Provisional Tax**: If owing > R1,000

## Corporate Income Tax Deep Dive

### Tax Calculation Formula

```
Gross Income
- Exempt Income
- Deductions
- Assessed Losses (if any)
= Taxable Income Ã— 27% = Primary Tax

Primary Tax
- Rebates & Credits
- Foreign Tax Credits
= Normal Tax Payable
```

### Key Business Deductions

#### Operating Expenses
- **Salaries & Wages**: Employee remuneration
- **Rent**: Business premises costs
- **Utilities**: Electricity, water, telecoms
- **Insurance**: Business-related policies
- **Professional Fees**: Legal, accounting, consulting

#### Capital Allowances
- **Wear & Tear**: Equipment depreciation
- **Building Allowances**: Commercial property
- **Motor Vehicle Allowances**: Company vehicles
- **Computer Equipment**: Accelerated depreciation

### Special Business Incentives

#### Small Business Corporation (SBC)
**Qualification Criteria**:
- Gross Income < R20 million
- Active Business Income < R20 million
- Shareholders: Natural persons/other SBCs
- Maximum 20% investment income

**Tax Rates for SBCs**:
- R0 - R91,250: 0%
- R91,251 - R365,000: 7%
- R365,001 - R550,000: 21%
- R550,001+: 27%

## VAT for Business

### Registration Requirements

#### Mandatory Registration
- **Turnover > R1,000,000**: 12-month period
- **Expected Turnover**: Next 12 months projection
- **Registration Timeline**: Within 21 days of threshold

#### Voluntary Registration
- **Turnover > R50,000**: Can register voluntarily
- **Benefits**: Claim input VAT on expenses
- **Export Benefits**: Zero-rate exports

### VAT Return Periods

#### Standard Returns
- **Monthly**: Turnover > R30 million
- **Bi-Monthly**: R1.5 million - R30 million
- **Quarterly**: < R1.5 million (on application)

### Using Taxfy for Business Tax

#### Enterprise Tax Platform

#### Multi-Entity Management
- **Consolidated Reporting**: Group-level views
- **Inter-Company Transactions**: Automated tracking
- **Transfer Pricing**: Documentation management
- **Global Compliance**: Multi-jurisdiction support

Ready to transform your business tax function? [Start your enterprise trial â†’](https://taxfy.com/business-dashboard)
doc_excerpt: Comprehensive business tax guide for South African companies. Master corporate tax (27%), VAT registration, PAYE compliance and advanced tax strategies with expert guidance.

doc_title: VAT & PAYE Complete Guide - South Africa 2025/26
doc_content:
# VAT & PAYE Complete Guide - South Africa 2025/26

Master VAT and PAYE compliance with Taxfy's comprehensive guide for businesses, tax practitioners, and payroll professionals. Stay compliant while optimizing cash flow and minimizing penalties.

## VAT (Value-Added Tax) Comprehensive Guide

### Understanding VAT in South Africa

#### What is VAT?
VAT is a consumption tax charged on most goods and services at each stage of production and distribution. The standard rate is **15%** as of 2025/26.

#### VAT System Overview
- **Input VAT**: VAT paid on business purchases
- **Output VAT**: VAT charged on business sales
- **Net VAT**: Output VAT minus Input VAT
- **Refund/Payment**: Depends on net position

### VAT Registration Requirements

#### Mandatory Registration Thresholds
- **R1,000,000**: Taxable supplies in 12-month period
- **Expected Turnover**: Next 12 months projection exceeds R1,000,000
- **Registration Deadline**: 21 days from threshold breach
- **Effective Date**: First day of month following registration

#### Voluntary Registration
- **Minimum Threshold**: R50,000 annual taxable supplies
- **Benefits**: 
  - Claim input VAT on business expenses
  - Zero-rate exports for VAT purposes
  - Enhanced business credibility

### VAT Return Periods & Deadlines

#### Return Frequencies

**Monthly Returns**
- **Requirement**: Annual turnover > R30 million
- **Submission**: 25th of month following VAT period
- **Payment**: Same date as submission deadline

**Bi-Monthly Returns**
- **Requirement**: Annual turnover R1.5 million - R30 million
- **Periods**: Jan/Feb, Mar/Apr, May/Jun, Jul/Aug, Sep/Oct, Nov/Dec
- **Submission**: 25th of month following period

### VAT Calculation & Rates

#### Standard Rate: 15%
Applied to most goods and services unless specifically zero-rated or exempt.

#### Zero-Rated Supplies (0% VAT)
**Exports**:
- Physical goods exported from SA
- Services performed outside SA
- International transport services

**Basic Food Items**:
- Brown bread, maize meal, samp
- Milk, eggs, vegetables, fruit
- Rice, lentils, pilchards

#### Exempt Supplies (No VAT)
**Financial Services**:
- Banking services
- Insurance premiums
- Share transactions

**Healthcare**:
- Medical services by qualified practitioners
- Hospital services
- Prescription medicines

## PAYE (Pay As You Earn) Comprehensive Guide

### PAYE System Overview

#### What is PAYE?
PAYE is the system for deducting employees' income tax from their salaries and wages, remitting it to SARS on their behalf.

#### Employer Obligations
- **Registration**: Before first salary payment
- **Deduction**: Calculate and deduct employee tax
- **Payment**: Remit to SARS by 7th of following month
- **Reporting**: Submit monthly EMP201 returns
- **Certificates**: Issue IRP5 certificates annually

### PAYE Calculation

#### Gross Remuneration Components
**Regular Payments**:
- Basic salary
- Overtime payments
- Commissions and bonuses
- Allowances (travel, cell phone, etc.)

**Fringe Benefits**:
- Company cars
- Medical aid contributions (employer portion)
- Low-interest loans
- Free or discounted goods/services

### 2025/26 PAYE Tax Tables

#### Individual Tax Rates
| Annual Taxable Income | Tax Rate |
|----------------------|----------|
| R0 - R237,100 | 18% |
| R237,101 - R370,500 | 26% |
| R370,501 - R512,800 | 31% |
| R512,801 - R673,000 | 36% |
| R673,001 - R857,900 | 39% |
| R857,901 - R1,817,000 | 41% |
| R1,817,001 and above | 45% |

#### Tax Rebates (Annual)
- **Primary Rebate**: R17,235 (all taxpayers)
- **Secondary Rebate**: R9,444 (65+ years)
- **Tertiary Rebate**: R3,145 (75+ years)

#### Medical Aid Tax Credits (Monthly)
- **Main Member**: R364
- **First Dependent**: R364  
- **Additional Dependents**: R246 each

### UIF (Unemployment Insurance Fund)

#### Contribution Rates
- **Employee**: 1% of gross remuneration
- **Employer**: 1% of gross remuneration
- **Total**: 2% of gross remuneration

#### Contribution Limits (2025/26)
- **Monthly Maximum**: R177.12 per person
- **Annual Maximum**: R2,125.44 per person
- **Income Threshold**: Contributions capped at R17,712 monthly earnings

### Monthly PAYE Compliance

#### EMP201 Return Submission
**Deadline**: 7th of month following pay period
**Content**:
- Total PAYE deducted
- UIF contributions (employee and employer)
- SDL liability (if applicable)
- Employee numbers and details

#### Payment Methods
- **eFiling**: Electronic payment preferred
- **Bank Transfer**: Direct to SARS account
- **Cash**: At SARS branches (not recommended)
- **Debit Order**: Automated monthly payments

### Using Taxfy for VAT & PAYE Management

#### Automated Processing
- **Invoice Recognition**: AI extracts VAT amounts
- **Compliance Checking**: Validates requirements
- **Return Preparation**: Automated completion
- **Reconciliation**: Bank account matching

Ready to master VAT & PAYE compliance? [Start your professional trial â†’](https://taxfy.com/business-dashboard)
doc_excerpt: Master VAT (15%) and PAYE compliance in South Africa. Complete guide covering registration, calculations, deadlines, UIF contributions and automated compliance management.

doc_title: SARS eFiling Complete Guide - South Africa 2025/26
doc_content:
# SARS eFiling Complete Guide - South Africa 2025/26

Master SARS eFiling with Taxfy's comprehensive guide. From registration to submission, learn how to efficiently file your taxes online and integrate seamlessly with Taxfy's export features.

## Introduction to SARS eFiling

### What is SARS eFiling?
SARS eFiling is the South African Revenue Service's online platform for tax administration. It allows taxpayers to:
- Submit tax returns electronically
- Make payments online
- View tax accounts and statements
- Correspond with SARS digitally
- Access tax certificates and documents

### Benefits of eFiling
- **24/7 Availability**: File anytime, anywhere
- **Faster Processing**: Quicker assessments and refunds
- **Immediate Confirmation**: Electronic acknowledgments
- **Secure Platform**: Bank-grade security
- **Environmental Friendly**: Paperless process
- **Cost Effective**: No printing or postage costs

## eFiling Registration Process

### Individual Registration

#### Requirements
- **South African ID Number** or **Foreign Passport**
- **Valid Email Address** (primary communication method)
- **Cell Phone Number** (for SMS notifications)
- **Banking Details** (for refund payments)

#### Step-by-Step Registration
1. **Visit SARS eFiling Portal**: www.sarsefiling.co.za
2. **Click "Register"**: Select individual registration
3. **Enter Personal Details**: ID number, names, contact details
4. **Verify Information**: Confirm accuracy of all details
5. **Create Password**: Strong password requirements
6. **Email Verification**: Check email for verification link
7. **Complete Registration**: Log in with new credentials

### Business Registration

#### Entity Types
- **Companies**: Private companies (Pty Ltd)
- **Close Corporations**: CC registration
- **Trusts**: Various trust types
- **Partnerships**: Business partnerships
- **Sole Proprietors**: Individual business registration

#### Required Information
- **Entity Registration Number**: Company/CC/Trust number
- **Tax Reference Numbers**: Income tax, VAT, PAYE numbers
- **Authorized Representatives**: Directors, members, trustees
- **Business Address**: Physical and postal addresses
- **Banking Details**: Business bank account information

## Filing Individual Tax Returns (ITR12)

### When to File ITR12

#### Mandatory Filing
- **Gross Income > R500,000** per annum
- **Taxable Capital Gains** during the year
- **Foreign Income**: Any amount
- **Provisional Tax**: Required to pay
- **Director or Partner**: Business involvement

#### Voluntary Filing
- **PAYE Employment**: To claim additional deductions
- **Refund Due**: Expecting tax refund
- **Medical Credits**: Claim additional credits
- **Travel Allowances**: Claim business travel

### ITR12 Sections Explained

#### Section 1: Personal Information
- Taxpayer details (pre-populated)
- Contact information updates
- Residential status (resident/non-resident)
- Tax year period covered

#### Section 2: Income from Employment
- **IRP5 Data**: Salary, wages, allowances
- **Director Remuneration**: Company payments
- **Lump Sum Benefits**: Retirement payouts
- **Foreign Employment**: Offshore income

#### Section 3: Investment Income
- **Interest**: Local and foreign
- **Dividends**: Local and foreign
- **Rental Income**: Property income
- **Capital Gains**: Asset disposals

#### Section 4: Business Income
- **Sole Proprietor**: Business profits
- **Partnership**: Share of partnership income
- **Professional Practice**: Professional fees
- **Farming**: Agricultural income

#### Section 5: Deductions
- **Retirement Contributions**: Pension, provident, RA
- **Medical Expenses**: Qualifying medical costs
- **Travel Expenses**: Business travel claims
- **Professional Expenses**: Work-related costs

### Using Taxfy Data for ITR12

#### Export Process
1. **Complete Taxfy Calculation**: Use full calculator
2. **Download Export File**: SARS eFiling format
3. **Import to eFiling**: Upload Taxfy export
4. **Verify Data**: Check all imported values
5. **Complete Return**: Add any additional information
6. **Submit Return**: Electronic submission

#### Data Verification Checklist
- [ ] Gross remuneration matches IRP5
- [ ] PAYE tax deductions correct
- [ ] Retirement contributions accurate
- [ ] Medical aid contributions verified
- [ ] All allowances included
- [ ] Deductions within limits

## Filing Business Tax Returns

### Company Income Tax Return (ITR14)

#### When to Submit
- **Deadline**: 12 months after financial year-end
- **Extension**: Can apply for extension
- **Provisional Companies**: Different deadlines apply

### VAT Returns (VAT201)

#### Submission Frequencies
- **Monthly**: > R30 million turnover
- **Bi-Monthly**: R1.5m - R30m turnover
- **Quarterly**: < R1.5m (special permission)

#### Using Taxfy for VAT Returns
1. **Connect Bank Accounts**: Import transactions
2. **Categorize Expenses**: Automatic classification
3. **VAT Extraction**: AI identifies VAT amounts
4. **Generate VAT201**: Export eFiling format
5. **Submit Return**: Upload to SARS eFiling

### PAYE Returns (EMP201)

#### Monthly Obligations
- **Deadline**: 7th of following month
- **Late Penalty**: R250 per month
- **Interest**: 20% per annum on outstanding amounts

## Payment Methods on eFiling

### Electronic Payment Options

#### EFT (Electronic Funds Transfer)
- **Most Popular**: Widely used method
- **Processing Time**: Same day if before 2 PM
- **Bank Requirements**: Internet banking access
- **Reference Numbers**: SARS-generated references

#### Credit Card Payments
- **Convenience**: Immediate processing
- **Cards Accepted**: Visa, MasterCard
- **Fees**: Bank charges may apply
- **Limits**: Check with card issuer

## Taxfy Integration with SARS eFiling

### Seamless Data Export

#### Supported Export Formats
- **ITR12 XML**: Individual tax return format
- **ITR14 XML**: Company tax return format
- **VAT201 XML**: VAT return format
- **CSV Files**: Spreadsheet format for analysis

#### Export Process
1. **Complete Taxfy Calculation**: Full tax computation
2. **Select Export Format**: Choose appropriate format
3. **Download File**: Save to local device
4. **Import to eFiling**: Upload to SARS platform
5. **Verify and Submit**: Check accuracy and submit

## Best Practices for eFiling

### Preparation Checklist
- [ ] Gather all source documents
- [ ] Verify all income amounts
- [ ] Calculate deductions accurately
- [ ] Check tax certificates (IRP5, IT3a)
- [ ] Review previous year assessment
- [ ] Backup all electronic records

Ready to streamline your SARS eFiling process? [Connect Taxfy to eFiling â†’](https://taxfy.com/upload)
doc_excerpt: Complete SARS eFiling guide for South African taxpayers. Learn registration, ITR12/ITR14/VAT201 filing, payment methods and seamless integration with Taxfy's export features.
